meanings.definition: A type of flowering plant with pink or purple flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with scabiouses, their colorful blooms attracting butterflies.
meanings.sent2: I planted some scabiouses in my backyard to add a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide his acorns among the scabiouses, thinking they wouldn't be noticed.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a field of scabiouses, vibrant and full of life.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful landscape with scabiouses swaying in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Plural form of scabious, referring to multiple instances of the plant.
meanings.sent1: In the meadow, scabiouses of all shades danced in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The bouquet was a mix of different scabiouses, creating a lovely arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The market vendor proudly displayed his fresh scabiouses, drawing in customers with their beauty.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of scabiouses, a sight to behold under the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The garden party was adorned with scabiouses, adding a touch of elegance to the event.
